Every sophomore at my high school had to complete a research paper in history on a topic of their choice, and I chose Roma persecution during the first half of the twentieth century. Even my teacher, a white lib fem socialist, constantly referred to my topic as "gypsies"

totally. I always think this about baby boomers in general, how they were enmeshed and active in the era of the civil rights movement, free love, anti-war, etc., yet so many of them became so obtuse and closed minded about issues like that as they got older.



ironically, it seems like those experiences have ultimately worked against them. they feel entitled to be offensive and awful because they've been through a time when things were worse, so now they're like "this is nothing compared to how things were in MY day! get over it!" they think they know everything there is to know.



pshhh old ppl amirite?

title: Madonna Throws "Gypsy" Themed Birthday Party

meta_data.description: - Celebrating her 57th birthday, Madonna decided to throw a gypsy birthday party . - Madonna called herself Gypsy Queen and her daughters Gypsy Princess #1 and Gypsy Princess #2 - Madonna got a new dog for her birthday and called it... Gypsy…
